children.text: "For over 40 years Mel Gussow was the lead cultural critic for

. During the full length of his career, Gussow recorded interviews with stars and lesser-known figures of the American and British theatre and literary scenes. He transformed some of these interviews into eight publications documenting the careers and processes of noted writers like Samuel Beckett, Arthur Miller, and Tom Stoppard. These recordings—on reel-to-reel and audiocassettes—were recorded at various places largely in and around New York.

The bulk of the nearly 1,000 audio recordings in Gussow's archive have never been included in publications. This remarkable collection captures a broad range of 40 years of literary and theatrical achievement through the voices of the people who made it.
Ninety of these recordings were preserved through a Recordings at Risk grant from the Council on Library and Information Resources (CLIR) and are now publicly available for the first time.
